solution.ProvisionConfirmNotice: The Teams Toolkit will provision resources and register corresponding resource providers under %s (Azure account) with %s (subscription). Costs may incur according to the pricing calculator.
solution.ProvisionConfirmEnvNotice:
Do you want to provision resources in %s environment?
%s (Azure account) with %s (subscription) will be used to provision the resources. Cost may incur according to the usage.
solution.ProvisionFailGuide: Provision resources failed, subscription id: '%s', resource group: '%s'. You can choose to rollback to delete the resource group and redo provision.
solution.ProvisionFailNotice: fail to provision '%s' in the cloud!
solution.DeployFailNotice: fail to deploy '%s' to the cloud!
solution.PublishFailNotice: fail to publish '%s' to the admin portal.
solution.FailedToDeployBeforeProvision: Failed to deploy because the resources have not been provisioned yet. Make sure you do the provision first. Click Get Help to learn more about why you need to provision.
solution.FailedToPublishBeforeProvision: Failed to publish because the resources have not been provisioned yet. Make sure you do the provision first. Click Get Help to learn more about why you need to provision.
solution.SPFxAskProvisionBeforePublish: Failed to publish because the teams app has not been provisioned yet. Please provision first. Click Get Help to learn more about why you need to provision.
solution.AddResourceNotice: [Teams Toolkit] Resource "%s" have been successfully configured for your project, trigger 'Teams: Provision in the cloud' will create the resource(s) in your Azure subscription.
solution.AddResourceNoticeForCli: [Teams Toolkit] Resource "%s" have been successfully configured for your project, run 'teamsfx provision' will create the resource(s) in your Azure subscription.
solution.AddCapabilityNotice: [Teams Toolkit] Capability %s has been successfully added to your project. F5 to local debug the application or trigger 'Teams: Provision in the cloud' to create resources in your Azure subscription for hosting.
solution.AddCapabilitiesNotice: [Teams Toolkit] Capabilities %s have been successfully added to your project. F5 to local debug the application or trigger 'Teams: Provision in the cloud' to create resources in your Azure subscription for hosting.
solution.AddCapabilityNoticeForCli: [Teams Toolkit] Capability %s has been successfully added to your project. Run 'teamsfx provision' to create resources in your Azure subscription for hosting.
solution.AddCapabilitiesNoticeForCli: [Teams Toolkit] Capabilities %s have been successfully added to your project. Run 'teamsfx provision' to create resources in your Azure subscription for hosting.
solution.AlreadyProvisionNotice: '%s' is already provisioned in the cloud, will create the teams app again if it has been removed.
solution.NotProvisionedNotice: '%s' is not provisioned in the cloud yet. Please provision first.
solution.GenerateArmTemplateFailNotice: '%s' Failed to create ARM template for required Azure services.
solution.UpdateArmTemplateFailNotice: '%s' Failed to update ARM template for required Azure services.
solution.UpdateArmTemplateNotice: The Azure resource template is updated based on your resource and capability selection. We recommend to initialize your project workspace with git init to track all changes.
solution.LocalDebugTenantConfirmNotice: You already run local debug for the Teams app in another tenant '%s'. You can sign out %s and sign in with the matched M365 account to re-use the previous local debug resource. If you really want to switch tenant for local debug, you can delete the %s file and re-run local debug.
solution.MigrationToArmAndMultiEnvMessage:
Teams Toolkit will upgrade your project configuration files to support the latest features. The upgrade process will not change your custom code and create the backup files in case revert is needed.
Notice this upgrade is a must-have to continue to use current version Teams Toolkit. If you are not ready to upgrade and want to continue to use the old version, please find Teams Toolkit in Extension and install the version <= 2.10.0
solution.MigrationToArmAndMultiEnvSuccessMessage: Upgrade succeeded. Your project is upgraded to new configuration files.
solution.NeedToUpdateTeamsToolkitVersionMessage: Your project is not supported. Please update Teams Toolkit to the latest version from the VSCode Extension Marketplace and make sure the setting (fx-extension: Insider Preview) is enabled
solution.MigrationToArmAndMultiEnvErrorMessage: Upgrade Failed. Please check the error message in Output window to troubleshoot and fix. You can also click Learn More for the FAQ and how to upgrade manually.
solution.MigrationToArmAndMultiEnvPreCheckErrorMe:
Upgrade Failed. '%s' doesn't exist or is not in json format. Please fix it and try again by running command (Teams: Upgrade project).
You can also click Learn More for the FAQ.

DeployArmTemplates.CompileBicepSuccessNotice: [%s] Successfully compile bicep files to JSON.
DeployArmTemplates.SuccessNotice: [%s] Successfully deploy ARM templates. Resource group name: %s. Deployment name: %s
DeployArmTemplates.FailNotice: [%s] Failed to deploy ARM templates. Resource group name: %s. Deployment name: %s

Progress.Title: Deploying ARM Templates
Progress.ExecuteDeployment: Deploying solution ARM templates to Azure. This could take several minutes.

solution.ProvisionStartNotice: [%s] Start provisioning. It could take several minutes.

SPFx.deployNotice: SharePoint package %s has been successfully deployed to [%s](%s).
SPFx.deployFailedNotice: You don't have permission to upload and deploy package to App Catalog %s, please use site admin account, or you can get your own free Microsoft 365 tenant from [M365 developer program](https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/dev-program)
SPFx.createAppCatalogNotice: There is no tenant app catalog under %s, you can Read more about how to create app catalog site.
